It is centered and appears to be a simple, geometric shape. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0568, 0.0] 2. **Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane** of the new coordinate system. The sketch consists of three loops and one circle on each side of the loops. 2.1. **Loop 1**: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0909, 0.0], End Point [0.6591, 0.0] - Arc 1: Start Point [0.6591, 0.0], Mid Point [0.75, 0.0909], End Point [0.6591, 0.1818] - Line 2: Start Point [0.6591, 0.1818], End Point [0.0909, 0.1818] - Arc 2: Start Point [0.0909, 0.1818], Mid Point [0.0, 0.0909], End Point [0.0909, 0.0] 2.2. **Loop 2**: - Circle 1: Center [0.0909, 0.0909], Radius 0.0284 2.3. **Loop 3**: - Circle 1: Center [0.6591, 0.0909], Radius 0.0284 3. **Scale the 2D sketch** by a factor of 0.75. 4. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch** along the normal direction by 0.0568 units. The final height of the part will be 0.75 units. This part is the base part for the CAD model. The subsequent parts will build upon this part using the defined operations. Note: The provided JSON indicates that the operation for this part is "NewBodyFeatureOperation", which means this part results in the creation of a new solid body. However, this information is not necessary for generating the CAD model, since the creation of a new solid body is the default behavior of any CAD software. Therefore, this information is omitted from the instructions.</description>
